message: The letter asks representatives to amend the Communications Decency Act to clarify that states, localities and territories retain authority to investigate and prosecute facilitators of child sex trafficking wherever they operate, including online, Laxalt's Office said in a statement.

data.description: Nevada Attorney General Adam Paul Laxalt and a bi-partisan coalition of 49 other state and territorial attorneys general sent a letter urging Congress to affirm that all law-enforcement agencies…
data.title: Nevada attorney general, 49 states seek sex trafficking law
